title: TODO
text: Migrate ggplot2 themes rdev Add tests, test coverage Add macro functions common plot elements like geom_rlm

title: jbplot ggplot2 style
text: quo theme applied venerable mtcars dataset. Example adapted ggplot2::theme_minimal():   viridis color scheme can added manually using ggplot2::scale_color_viridis_d():
code: p1 <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() +   labs(     title = "Fuel economy declines as weight increases",     subtitle = "(1973-74)",     caption = "Data from the 1974 Motor Trend US magazine.",     tag = "Figure 1",     x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",     y = "Fuel economy (mpg)",     color = "Gears"   )  p1 p1 + theme_quo() p1 +   theme_quo() +   scale_color_viridis_d()

title: jbplot ggplot2 style
text: Quo designed paired viridis color scale, added calling one continuous (c) discrete (d) viridis color scales: ggplot2::scale_color_viridis_c() ggplot2::scale_fill_viridis_c() ggplot2::scale_color_viridis_d() ggplot2::scale_fill_viridis_d() Sample plots using default theme color scales:    plots applying viridis quo:
code: txsamp <- subset(txhousing, city %in% c("Houston", "Fort Worth", "San Antonio", "Dallas", "Austin"))  (d <- ggplot(data = txsamp, aes(x = sales, y = median)) +   geom_point(aes(colour = city))) (p <- ggplot(txsamp, aes(x = median, fill = city)) +   geom_histogram(position = "dodge", binwidth = 15000)) (v <- ggplot(faithfuld) +   geom_tile(aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density))) d + scale_color_viridis_d() + theme_quo() p + scale_fill_viridis_d() + theme_quo() v + scale_fill_viridis_c() + theme_quo()

title: jbplot ggplot2 style
text: Grid lines can selectively disabled using theme_quo():
code: d + scale_color_viridis_d() + theme_quo(minor = FALSE) p + scale_fill_viridis_d() + theme_quo(x = FALSE) v + scale_fill_viridis_c() + theme_quo(major = FALSE, minor = FALSE)

title: Authors and Citation
text: John Benninghoff. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Benninghoff J (2024). jbplot: Personal Collection ggplot2 Themes. R package version 1.4.2,  https://github.com/jabenninghoff/jbplot, https://jabenninghoff.github.io/jbplot/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {jbplot: A Personal Collection of ggplot2 Themes},   author = {John Benninghoff},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.4.2,  https://github.com/jabenninghoff/jbplot},   url = {https://jabenninghoff.github.io/jbplot/}, }

title: A Personal Collection of ggplot2 Themes
text: Personal Collection ggplot2 Themes: personal collection ggplot2 themes styles. Feel free use /fork project!

title: A Personal Collection of ggplot2 Themes
text: can install development version jbplot GitHub : using renv:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("jabenninghoff/jbplot") # install.packages("renv") renv::install("jabenninghoff/jbplot")

title: A Personal Collection of ggplot2 Themes
text: Changelog: See “Changelog” NEWS.md. Planned: TODO

title: A Personal Collection of ggplot2 Themes
text: jbplot allows creation styled plots, mtcars example, adapted ggplot2::theme_minimal():  information, see “jbplot ggplot2 style” get started vignette.
code: library(ggplot2) library(jbplot)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() +   labs(     title = "Fuel economy declines as weight increases",     subtitle = "(1973-74)",     caption = "Data from the 1974 Motor Trend US magazine.",     x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",     y = "Fuel economy (mpg)",     color = "Gears"   ) +   theme_quo() +   scale_color_viridis_d()

what: Annotate using quo theme font — annotate_quo
title: Annotate using quo theme font — annotate_quo
text: wrapper ggplot2::annotate() sets font Lato.

title: Annotate using quo theme font — annotate_quo
code: annotate_quo(   geom,   x = NULL,   y = NULL,   xmin = NULL,   xmax = NULL,   ymin = NULL,   ymax = NULL,   xend = NULL,   yend = NULL,   family = "Lato",   ...,   na.rm = FALSE )

title: Annotate using quo theme font — annotate_quo
text: geom name geom use annotation x, y, xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax, xend, yend positioning aesthetics - must specify least one . family Font family use. Defaults "Lato". ... arguments passed layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like colour = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat. na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed.

title: Annotate using quo theme font — annotate_quo
code: library(ggplot2) library(showtext) #> Loading required package: sysfonts #> Loading required package: showtextdb  font_add_google("Lato", "Lato") showtext_auto() # workaround for https://github.com/yixuan/showtext/issues/51 showtext_opts(dpi = 192)  ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy)) +   geom_point() +   geom_rlm(method = "loess") +   annotate_quo("label", x = 5.5, y = 30, label = "hwy increases for displ greater than 5.5") +   theme_quo()

title: Black and white histogram — geom_hist_bw
text: wrapper ggplot2::geom_histogram() sets color black fill white.

title: Black and white histogram — geom_hist_bw
code: geom_hist_bw(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   position = "stack",   color = "black",   fill = "white",   ...,   binwidth = NULL,   bins = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Black and white histogram — geom_hist_bw
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). position Position adjustment, either string naming adjustment (e.g. "jitter" use position_jitter), result call position adjustment function. Use latter need change settings adjustment. color Histogram color. Defaults "black". fill Histogram fill. Defaults "white". ... arguments passed layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like colour = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat. binwidth width bins. Can specified numeric value function calculates width unscaled x. , "unscaled x" refers original x values data, application scale transformation. specifying function along grouping structure, function called per group. default use number bins bins, covering range data. always override value, exploring multiple widths find best illustrate stories data. bin width date variable number days time; bin width time variable number seconds. bins Number bins. Overridden binwidth. Defaults 30. na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. orientation orientation layer. default (NA) automatically determines orientation aesthetic mapping. rare event fails can given explicitly setting orientation either "x" "y". See Orientation section detail. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders().

title: Black and white histogram — geom_hist_bw
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg, aes(hwy)) +   geom_hist_bw(binwidth = 1)

title: Linear smoothing — geom_lm
text: wrapper ggplot2::geom_smooth() sets method lm() formula y ~ x.

title: Linear smoothing — geom_lm
code: geom_lm(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   position = "identity",   ...,   method = "lm",   formula = y ~ x,   se = TRUE,   na.rm = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Linear smoothing — geom_lm
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). position Position adjustment, either string naming adjustment (e.g. "jitter" use position_jitter), result call position adjustment function. Use latter need change settings adjustment. ... arguments passed layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like colour = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat. method Smoothing method (function) use, accepts either NULL character vector, e.g. "lm", "glm", "gam", "loess" function, e.g. MASS::rlm mgcv::gam, stats::lm, stats::loess. "auto" also accepted backwards compatibility.  equivalent NULL. method = NULL smoothing method chosen based size largest group (across panels). stats::loess() used less 1,000 observations; otherwise mgcv::gam() used formula = y ~ s(x, bs = "cs") method = "REML". Somewhat anecdotally, loess gives better appearance, \(O(N^{2})\) memory, work larger datasets. fewer 1,000 observations want use gam() model method = NULL use, set method = "gam", formula = y ~ s(x, bs = "cs"). formula Formula use smoothing function, eg. y ~ x, y ~ poly(x, 2), y ~ log(x). NULL default, case method = NULL implies formula = y ~ x fewer 1,000 observations formula = y ~ s(x, bs = "cs") otherwise. se Display confidence interval around smooth? (TRUE default, see level control.) na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. orientation orientation layer. default (NA) automatically determines orientation aesthetic mapping. rare event fails can given explicitly setting orientation either "x" "y". See Orientation section detail. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders().

title: Linear smoothing — geom_lm
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy)) +   geom_point() +   geom_lm()

title: Robust linear smoothing — geom_rlm
text: wrapper ggplot2::geom_smooth() sets method MASS::rlm() formula y ~ x.

title: Robust linear smoothing — geom_rlm
code: geom_rlm(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   position = "identity",   ...,   method = MASS::rlm,   formula = y ~ x,   se = TRUE,   na.rm = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Robust linear smoothing — geom_rlm
text: mapping Set aesthetic mappings created aes(). specified inherit.aes = TRUE (default), combined default mapping top level plot. must supply mapping plot mapping. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). position Position adjustment, either string naming adjustment (e.g. "jitter" use position_jitter), result call position adjustment function. Use latter need change settings adjustment. ... arguments passed layer(). often aesthetics, used set aesthetic fixed value, like colour = "red" size = 3. may also parameters paired geom/stat. method Smoothing method (function) use, accepts either NULL character vector, e.g. "lm", "glm", "gam", "loess" function, e.g. MASS::rlm mgcv::gam, stats::lm, stats::loess. "auto" also accepted backwards compatibility.  equivalent NULL. method = NULL smoothing method chosen based size largest group (across panels). stats::loess() used less 1,000 observations; otherwise mgcv::gam() used formula = y ~ s(x, bs = "cs") method = "REML". Somewhat anecdotally, loess gives better appearance, \(O(N^{2})\) memory, work larger datasets. fewer 1,000 observations want use gam() model method = NULL use, set method = "gam", formula = y ~ s(x, bs = "cs"). formula Formula use smoothing function, eg. y ~ x, y ~ poly(x, 2), y ~ log(x). NULL default, case method = NULL implies formula = y ~ x fewer 1,000 observations formula = y ~ s(x, bs = "cs") otherwise. se Display confidence interval around smooth? (TRUE default, see level control.) na.rm FALSE, default, missing values removed warning. TRUE, missing values silently removed. orientation orientation layer. default (NA) automatically determines orientation aesthetic mapping. rare event fails can given explicitly setting orientation either "x" "y". See Orientation section detail. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics, rather combining . useful helper functions define data aesthetics inherit behaviour default plot specification, e.g. borders().

title: Robust linear smoothing — geom_rlm
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy)) +   geom_point() +   geom_rlm()

what: Create a ggplot Donut (Doughnut) Plot — ggplot_donut
title: Create a ggplot Donut (Doughnut) Plot — ggplot_donut
text: Create donut plot data frame containing groups corresponding values ggplot2::ggplot().

title: Create a ggplot Donut (Doughnut) Plot — ggplot_donut
code: ggplot_donut(data, group = "group", value = "n", hsize = 2)

title: Create a ggplot Donut (Doughnut) Plot — ggplot_donut
text: data Default dataset use plot. already data.frame, converted one fortify(). specified, must supplied layer added plot. group Name column use plot colors. value Name column use sector size. hsize Size donut hole. Defaults 2, must non-negative value. value 0 creates pie chart.

title: Create a ggplot Donut (Doughnut) Plot — ggplot_donut
text: Implemented using ggplot2::geom_col(), ggplot2::coord_polar(), ggplot2::xlim(), adapted guides R Graph Gallery R CHARTS. default plot elements disabled using ggplot2::theme() ggplot2::element_blank().

title: Create a ggplot Donut (Doughnut) Plot — ggplot_donut
code: library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE) library(ggplot2)  mtcars |>   count(cyl) |>   mutate(cyl = as.factor(cyl)) |>   ggplot_donut(group = "cyl")

what: Create a Donut Percentage Plot — ggplot_donut_percent
title: Create a Donut Percentage Plot — ggplot_donut_percent
text: Create donut plot text value percentage center, using ggplot_donut().

title: Create a Donut Percentage Plot — ggplot_donut_percent
code: ggplot_donut_percent(p, accuracy = NULL, hsize = 4, size = 20, family = "Lato")

title: Create a Donut Percentage Plot — ggplot_donut_percent
text: p Proportion plot. Must value 0 1. accuracy number round . Use (e.g.) 0.01 show 2 decimal places precision. NULL, default, uses heuristic ensure breaks minimum number digits needed show difference adjacent values. Applied rescaled data. hsize Size donut hole. Defaults 4, must non-negative value. size Font size use. Defaults 20. family Font family use. Defaults "Lato".

title: Create a Donut Percentage Plot — ggplot_donut_percent
text: ggplot_donut_percent() creates data frame calls ggplot_donut() create base plot, removes legend, adds geom_text() centered plot. text label formatted using scales::label_percent() specified accuracy.

title: Create a Donut Percentage Plot — ggplot_donut_percent
code: library(showtext)  font_add_google("Lato", "Lato") showtext_auto() # workaround for https://github.com/yixuan/showtext/issues/51 showtext_opts(dpi = 192)  ggplot_donut_percent(0.6)

what: jbplot: A Personal Collection of ggplot2 Themes — jbplot-package
title: jbplot: A Personal Collection of ggplot2 Themes — jbplot-package
text: personal collection ggplot2 themes styles.

title: jbplot: A Personal Collection of ggplot2 Themes — jbplot-package
text: Maintainer: John Benninghoff jbenninghoff@mac.com (ORCID)

title: Quo Theme — theme_quo
text: opinionated ggplot2 theme based ggplot2::theme_minimal(). Viridis Quo!

title: Quo Theme — theme_quo
code: theme_quo(   major = TRUE,   major.x = TRUE,   major.y = TRUE,   minor = TRUE,   minor.x = TRUE,   minor.y = TRUE,   x = TRUE,   y = TRUE )

title: Quo Theme — theme_quo
text: major, major.x, major.y, minor, minor.x, minor.y, x, y set FALSE disable grid lines setting appropriate panel.grid element ggplot2::element_blank().

title: Quo Theme — theme_quo
text: Quo requires Lato, can installed macOS using brew install font-lato. Quo designed paired viridis color scale, added calling one continuous (c) discrete (d) viridis color scales: ggplot2::scale_color_viridis_c() ggplot2::scale_fill_viridis_c() ggplot2::scale_color_viridis_d() ggplot2::scale_fill_viridis_d()

title: Quo Theme — theme_quo
code: # adapted from ggplot2::theme_minimal() library(ggplot2) library(showtext)  font_add_google("Lato", "Lato") showtext_auto() # workaround for https://github.com/yixuan/showtext/issues/51 showtext_opts(dpi = 192)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() +   labs(     title = "Fuel economy declines as weight increases",     subtitle = "(1973-74)",     caption = "Data from the 1974 Motor Trend US magazine.",     tag = "Figure 1",     x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",     y = "Fuel economy (mpg)",     color = "Gears"   ) +   theme_quo() +   scale_color_viridis_d()
